channel.title: Nibiru
channel.description:
I was browsing Youtube and came across a video talking about Planet Nibiru, which was supposedly discovered in ancient times and obviously tied in from religious/cultural views; however, I will not bring those into this discussion. If you haven't noticed, there have been different sightings since April which have increased astronomers' belief as to Planet Nibiru being real. There are many videos you can find that show Nibiru beside and above the Sun during the period of time from April to October, which people believe is an effect due to the axis of Earth tilting.
I just wanted to see what everyone else thought about this; please keep any religious matters out of your reply, although I highly respect these types of views. I'm not trying to encourage any apocalyptic event or anything close to that, so don't get that thought.

item.title: Nibiru
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Seriously? Defining a fucking astronomer and programmer as the same thing; it doesn’t matter if the person is just a freelancer or not, they still hold that position or title. I’m not trying to prove anything here, so stop replying with something that doesn’t matter. Also, the astronomers were wrong to a certain extent, because they changed their mind. Pluto was no longer a planet as of 2006. It doesn’t matter if it is a slight distinction of a planet now, that doesn’t change the fact of it being a dwarf planet; I know what a planet is in comparison to a dwarf planet, so I don’t need the clarification of it. Thanks for your input on this though.

Read full topic

item.title: Nibiru
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Tutorial:

The only problem is that the same people you say can find planets 4,500 light years away are the same people that reclassified Pluto as a dwarf planet.

they’re not ‘the same people’ any more than say, a doctor from the united states and a doctor from kazakhstan ‘are the same (group of) people’

pluto is a ‘dwarf’ planet, the astronomers who classified pluto as a ‘planet’ weren’t wrong and this is important to know

up until pluto was called a ‘dwarf’ planet the definition of a planet would have included pluto, the ruling that classified pluto as a dwarf planet sets a proper definition for what is to be considered a planet and what is to be considered a dwarf planet and/or satellite

and lets get this straight, a dwarf planet has nothing to do with size, ‘dwarf planet’ as a name means nothing

a planet is defined as:

The IAU … resolves that planets and other bodies, except satellites, in our Solar System be defined into three distinct categories in the following way:
(1) A planet1 is a celestial body that (a) is in orbit around the Sun, (b) has sufficient mass for its self-gravity to overcome rigid body forces so that it assumes a hydrostatic equilibrium (nearly round) shape, and © has cleared the neighbourhood around its orbit.

this means that a planet is a planet if (a) it orbits the sun (both pluto and earth do this) (b) is round (both pluto and earth are) © basically that the orbit of a planet is unassisted by other celestial bodies, (which earth does, pluto does not)

a dwarf planet is defined as:

(2) A “dwarf planet” is a celestial body that (a) is in orbit around the Sun, (b) has sufficient mass for its self-gravity to overcome rigid body forces so that it assumes a hydrostatic equilibrium (nearly round) shape,2 © has not cleared the neighbourhood around its orbit, and (d) is not a satellite.

the orbit of pluto around the sun is assisted by other celestial bodies that without such bodies, would not be able to complete an orbit of the sun, for the other 8 planets this is not true, the 8 planets we have are able to complete their orbit of the sun unassisted from any other celestial body

just the fact that neptune IS a planet means that pluto can never be a planet, neptune is preventing pluto from orbiting because it got ‘there first’

Tutorial:

Also, it seems that people are talking “shit” like this seriously, because tons of reports and videos have been created due to this.

by everyone except astronomers

Read full topic

item.title: Nibiru
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

The only problem is that the same people you say can find planets 4,500 light years away are the same people that reclassified Pluto as a dwarf planet. People are prone to encounter error and maybe the reason people are supposedly seeing “Nibiru” now is due to its predicted orbital path, which is thought to be massive.

Also, it seems that people are talking “shit” like this seriously, because tons of reports and videos have been created due to this. Forgive me if my naturally bound curiosity has mislead me until discussing what others believe, not my own thoughts.

Read full topic

item.title: Nibiru
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:3, topic:464660”][quote author=Niall link=topic=568741.msg4127987#msg4127987 date=1350709915]
nibiru is absolutely with 100% certainty completely made up

absolutely no astronomer “believes” nibiru is out there
[/quote]
Actually yes… Nibiru was the term ancient astronomers used. Percival Lowell started searching for another possible planet beyond Neptune, planet x, which was then halted when the discovery of Pluto was announced. Some astronomers now interpret planet x as being Nibiru.

en.wikipedia.org

Planets beyond Neptune

Following the discovery of the planet Neptune in 1846, there was considerable speculation that another planet might exist beyond its orbit. The search began in the mid-19th century and culminated at the start of the 20th with Percival Lowell's quest for Planet X. Lowell proposed the Planet X hypothesis to explain apparent discrepancies in the orbits of the giant planets, particularly Uranus and Neptune, speculating that the gravity of a large unseen ninth planet could have perturbed Uranus eno Cl...

I’m not trying to prove that it is real, but it is obvious that some astronomers believe Nibiru is out there, because one of them created the reference of Nibiru being the mysterious planet x.

Edit: Nibiru is 100% made up, since it was a term created by an ancient civilization, not by the modern society.[/quote]

well you see, the problem here is that you have 1 story/explanation of what ‘nibiru’ is in a sea of about a million stories or explanations

the reason no one takes shit like nibiru seriously is because no one explains themselves and sticks to vague answers that could stick to just about everything, “nibiru is a planet beyond neptune!!! so is pluto!!! therefore pluto is nibiru!!!”

there’s also a school of thought that is that nibiru is a planet beyond pluto:

hint: pluto was discovered in 1930, in this day and age we can detect planets 4,500 lightyears away from the dip in brightness they cause by the orbit of their sun, if there was a freaking planet in our solar system that has yet to been discovered by now it would have been discovered and if said planet was visible from the eye then it would have been discovered centuries ago

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:2, topic:464660”]nibiru is absolutely with 100% certainty completely made up

absolutely no astronomer “believes” nibiru is out there[/quote]
Actually yes… Nibiru was the term ancient astronomers used. Percival Lowell started searching for another possible planet beyond Neptune, planet x, which was then halted when the discovery of Pluto was announced. Some astronomers now interpret planet x as being Nibiru.

en.wikipedia.org

Planets beyond Neptune

Following the discovery of the planet Neptune in 1846, there was considerable speculation that another planet might exist beyond its orbit. The search began in the mid-19th century and culminated at the start of the 20th with Percival Lowell's quest for Planet X. Lowell proposed the Planet X hypothesis to explain apparent discrepancies in the orbits of the giant planets, particularly Uranus and Neptune, speculating that the gravity of a large unseen ninth planet could have perturbed Uranus eno Cl...

I’m not trying to prove that it is real, but it is obvious that some astronomers believe Nibiru is out there, because one of them created the reference of Nibiru being the mysterious planet x.

Edit: Nibiru is 100% made up, since it was a term created by an ancient civilization, not by the modern society.
